intro: Dicliptera glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, erect stems. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with prominent veins and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are typically greenish or pale yellow, with tiny, clustered spikelets that are often covered in fine hairs. Dicliptera glandulosa is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some African countries.
